sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>leader</radical> of <radical>alligators</radical>... she's no ordinary leader, that's for sure. She's not a politician.. she's not a queen... She's one of the <kanji>Other</kanji> Ones, a group of strange, eccentric people who become leaders of animals.
meaningInfo: Imagine different groups of leaders - they're all dressed nice and normal. Then, off to the side are the leaders who are leaders of bears, cats, alligators, and narwhals... they're the <kanji>other</kanji> ones, no matter how you look at it. They are in their own group, and they are considered "others" because society won't accept them :(
readingMnemonic:
To remember the reading <ja>た</ja>, we use the word "Taco"

Then there's the <kanji>other</kanji>s of the others. These are the <reading>ta</reading>co (<ja>た</ja>) worshipers. They're really strange.
readingInfo: Just imagine the "others" shaking their heads at these taco worshipers. Seriously, what the heck?
